description: Anaerobium acetethylicum is a species of anaerobic bacteria that belongs to the Firmicutes phylum. It is a Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, and non-motile bacterium. Anaerobium acetethylicum is characterized by its ability to ferment acetate and ethanol as carbon and energy sources under anaerobic conditions. The bacterium is known to be involved in the degradation of organic matter in anaerobic environments, such as sediments, wastewater treatment plants, and anaerobic digesters. Its metabolic activities contribute to the cycling of carbon and the production of methane, making it an important player in the anaerobic food web.
